questions.question: A science laboratory uses two types of test tubes, type-A and type-B. Each type-A test tube requires 18ml of cleaning solution and each type-B requires 31ml. If the laboratory uses 2100ml of cleaning solution to clean all the tubes, which of the following equations shows the possible number of type-A tubes, A, and number of type-B tubes, B, in the laboratory?
questions.whyCorrectAnswer: The equation 18A + 31B = 2100 correctly represents the total cleaning solution used by both types of test tubes, where each type-A requires 18ml and each type-B requires 31ml.

questions.question: A marathon runner, at his peak performance, runs 18 miles on a mountain terrain and 15 miles in the city. If the runner runs a total of nearly 300 miles in M mountain terrains and C cities, which of the following equations best represents the relationship between M and C?
questions.whyCorrectAnswer: The equation 18M + 15C = 300 correctly represents total miles run in both the city and mountain terrains, with each M term representing the miles run in the mountain and each C term representing the miles run in the city.

questions.question: An artisan makes high quality pens and pencils. Each pen takes 6 hours and each pencil takes 3 hours to make. If the artisan works for a total of 42 hours, which of the following equations shows the number of pens, p, and number of pencils, v, that the artisan can make?
questions.whyCorrectAnswer: The equation 6p + 3v = 42 correctly represents the total hours spent making the pens and pencils, with each pen taking 6 hours and each pencil taking 3 hours.

questions.question: A rectangular swimming pool has a length of L meters and a width of W meters. The total area of the pool is 900 square meters. Which equation represents the area of the plot in terms of length and width?
questions.whyCorrectAnswer: The equation LW = 900 correctly represents the area of a rectangular swimming pool, where L is the length and W is the width.

questions.question: A farmer cultivates wheat and barley. He earns an average of $7,000 per acre of wheat and $12,000 per acre of barley. If the farmer wishes to earn a total of $60,000 from these two crops, which of the following equations shows the relationship between the number of acres of wheat, w, and the number of acres of barley, b, required?
questions.whyCorrectAnswer: The equation 7,000w + 12,000b = 60,000 correctly shows the total earnings from both wheat and barley, where every acre of wheat earns $7,000 and every acre of barley earns $12,000.

questions.question: A rectangular parking space has a length of L meters and a width of W meters. The total area of the parking space is 800 square meters. Which equation represents the area of the space in terms of length and width?
questions.whyCorrectAnswer: The equation LW = 800 correctly represents the area of a rectangular parking space, where L is the length and W is the width.

questions.question: An artist paints landscapes and portraits. Each landscape takes 7 hours and each portrait takes 4 hours to complete. If the artist works a total of 49 hours, which equation shows the number of landscapes, l, and number of portraits, p, that the artist can complete?
questions.whyCorrectAnswer: The equation 7l + 4p = 49 correctly represents the total hours spent painting landscapes and portraits, with each landscape taking 7 hours and each portrait taking 4 hours.

questions.question: A bakery bakes two types of bread, rye and whole wheat. Each rye requires 13 minutes in the oven and each whole wheat takes 17 minutes. If the bakery has a total of 300 minutes for baking, which equation represents the relationship between the number of rye breads, R, and whole wheat breads, W, that can be baked?
questions.whyCorrectAnswer: The equation 13R + 17W = 300 correctly represents the total baking time with each rye bread taking 13 minutes and each whole wheat bread taking 17 minutes.

questions.question: A rectangular garden has a length of L meters and a width of W meters. The total perimeter of the garden is 840 meters. Which equation represents the perimeter of the plot in terms of length and width?
questions.whyCorrectAnswer: The equation 2L + 2W = 840 correctly represents the perimeter of a rectangular plot, where L is the length and W is the width.

questions.question: A farmer cultivates apples and oranges. He earns an average of $8,000 per acres of apple and $13,000 per acres of oranges. If the farmer wishes to earn a total of $65,000 from these two crops, which of the following equations shows the relationship between the number of acres of apples, a, and the number of acres of oranges, o, required?
questions.whyCorrectAnswer: The equation 8,000a + 13,000o = 65,000 correctly shows the total earnings from both apple and oranges, where every acre of apple earns $8,000 and every acre of oranges earns $13,000.

questions.question: An engineering workshop produces two types of parts - X and Y. Each X part requires 10 units of raw material and each Y part requires 15 units. If the workshop uses a total of 1150 units of material to produce all the parts, what equation represents the relationship between the number of X parts, X, and Y parts, Y produced?
questions.whyCorrectAnswer: The equation 10X + 15Y = 1150 correctly represents the total material used where each X part requires 10 units and each Y part requires 15 units of raw material.
